The house was great and all the native plants and wildflowers on the property made it a perfect spot!
A beautiful home! Our family really enjoyed the outdoor deck, and fire pit! We felt right at home.

This is a great place to relax and enjoy the beauty of the area. The house has a lot of wonderful amenities (ie sugar, toilet paper, shampoo) that make it really easy for those traveling! Dave was super nice and helpful when we had a question!

I recently had the pleasure of staying at the most idyllic farmhouse retreat, and I cannot express enough how truly extraordinary my experience was. Beautiful farm house, even better than the pictures. Very well furnished and stocked with everything you need. Dave was very responsive and fair. Look forward to staying there again for our next visit!

very nice older house that had all the accomodations we needed, we wont hesitate to use it again if we come back to the area

Absolutely wonderful.

Dave made everything about the stay easy, responded quickly and was overall a great host.
Recommend a 100 times over.
From an east central IL gal who misses everything this home offers.

The house and setting is beautiful and exceeded our expectations. The beds were comfortable , rooms spacious, and we enjoyed walking the wildflower path. We listened to the owls as we fell asleep. Thank you!

The Peaceful Modern Farmhouse is a wonderful, updated farmhouse on a very quiet location about a mile outside of Hoopeston. We were fortunate enough to have been put up there by Hoopeston’s Loraine Theater while we were in town for a performance. The house had all the charm of an older 100 year old home but with all the modern conveniences such as updated kitchen, bathrooms, laundry etc. The back porch was a great place to sit and visit with band members in the hustle and bustle of our busy traveling life and it was such a treat to sit and listen to listen to and watch the birds while having morning coffee. There is a nice gas grill, the kitchen has all that is needed to cook meals, including new appliances.  The downstairs has a lot of comfortable seating space in the two living areas plus a large flat screen TV.  The beds in all 4 bedrooms were very comfortable. The only negative I can think of was that the air conditioner, which kept the downstairs very cool, struggled to keep the three bedrooms on the second floor cool enough so it was a little warm. The upper attic room had its own air conditioner so was very comfortable. Other than that, it was a wonderful stay and I would happily stay there again. I recommend it to anyone needing a place to stay while in Hoopeston.
 
Diane

This place is exactly as it is described and better. The remodel is done so well. The beds were so comfortable and the grounds were teaming with song birds, rabbits and squirrels. BEAUTIFUL home with a lot of space!

I stayed at Dave's Hoopston farm with a group of of 4 other friends and two small children. Dave’s family home was such a great retreat for our friends and their kids - 4 couples with 4 kids under 5. Very comfortable stay with a big group - loved the big living room and dining room table which was great for playing games and letting the kids sprawl out with their toys.

Dave’s place is a perfect place to meet up with family or friends. It is comfortable and well stocked with anything you could possibly need. Great sunset view from the back deck. Thank you, we had a lovely stay.

It was wonderful and so stress free which is the best when you’re in vacation!!!!

Our stay at Dave’s place in Hoopeston was wonderful! House and property are beautiful. Kitchen well appointed. Views from the windows are gorgeous. Lovely, low traffic gravel roads for running. Great coffee shop and IGA grocery in town.

Beautiful property! Very clean and in Immaculate condition. This home has been very well renovated with the perfect blend of modern and original. Definitely recommend!
My second stay at this exceptional property. Such a great place, and right in the heart of the town. Terrific host, too, who had everything prepped and ready. Looking forward to my next visit!
Tall ceilings, modern kitchen, tons of extras to make it even more hospitable. An excellent stay!

This location is clean and well-decorated. It was well-suited for our family of 3. We will likely stay here again .
A true jewel in a friendly town. A perfect spot for a getaway weekend.
A beautiful little place to stay in the heart of downtown Covington. Very close to the grocery store, you could walk there. The little courtyard put back was very cute.

Hope to always stay there. Perfect in every way. So much better than a hotel.

Wonderful place to stay. Very neat and historic feel.

This was our 2nd stay and again it was a great stay. We love the little touches like having toiletries and snacks available.

We really loved this little cabin. The lake is cool, deep, clear, and very peaceful. It's rare these days to find a lake that's not packed with houses all the way around, but that's exactly what you'll get here. The whole time we were there, we only saw one other person on the lake, and that was only briefly. I think there are maybe 3-4 houses on the whole of the lake, including this cabin. So it's very quiet, and great for paddleboarding, kayaking, fishing, etc., especially if you've got kids and don't want to worry about fighting other boat traffic.
The house itself is pretty small, but it would be great for a small family of 2-5. All the amenities are there, and the hosts even provide kayaks, a paddleboard, and a canoe for your use. You're also very close to Kickapoo State Park which offers even more hiking and water-related activities.
Brittany was very easy to work with, always responded to my questions quickly, and the check-in process was smooth and easy.
All in all, we thoroughly enjoyed our time here. I'm really hoping to make it back, and I'll bring my fishing pole next time!
